name: Rose
description: Classic and romantic, roses come in various colors, each symbolizing different emotions.

name: Sunflower
description: With bright yellow petals surrounding a dark central disk, sunflowers are known for their cheerful appearance and association with sunshine

name: Tulip
description: Graceful and diverse in color, tulips symbolize spring and are cherished for their elegant, cup-shaped blooms.

name: Lily
description: Majestic and fragrant, lilies come in various types, including Oriental and Calla lilies, and are often associated with purity and renewal.

name: Daisy:
description: Simple and charming, daisies are symbolic of innocence and are known for their white petals surrounding a bright yellow center.

name: Orchid
description: Exotic and elegant, orchids boast intricate blooms and are prized for their unique beauty, representing love, beauty, and strength.

name: Lavender
description: Delicate and fragrant, lavender flowers are known for their calming scent and are often used in aromatherapy and culinary applications.

name: Carnation
description: With ruffled petals and a spicy fragrance, carnations come in various colors, each conveying different sentiments, from love to admiration.

name: Cherry Blossom
description: Symbolizing the fleeting beauty of life, cherry blossoms are celebrated in spring for their pink and white blooms.

name: Daffodil
description: Emblematic of spring renewal, daffodils feature trumpet-shaped flowers in various hues.

name: Hibiscus
description: Vibrant and tropical, hibiscus flowers are known for their large, colorful blooms and are associated with beauty and femininity.

name: Poppy
description: Bold and distinctive, poppies are known for their vibrant red color and are symbolic of remembrance and peace.

name: Dahlia
description: Diverse in shape and color, dahlias are prized for their intricate blooms.

name: Madeiran Squill
description: This is a rare bulbous perennial that is native to the island of Madeira. In late fall to early winter, when most other perennials are finishing up for the year, this Squill blooms a cone full of amethyst blooms.

name: Acacia
description: Acacias are also distinguished by their small, often fragrant flowers, which are arranged in compact globular or cylindrical clusters.

name: Marigold
description: Vibrant and resilient, marigolds are cherished worldwide, often holding cultural and religious significance, symbolizing joy, courage, and positive energy.

name: Allium
description: Graceful globes of blossoms atop slender stems, alliums, including onions, garlic, and ornamental varieties,

name: Anemone
description: Delicate and captivating, anemone flowers feature vibrant petals surrounding a contrasting center.

name: Aster
description: Radiant and daisy-like, asters bloom in an array of colors, symbolizing love, patience, and elegance.

name: Azalea
description: : Bursting with vibrant clusters of flowers, azaleas showcase a spectrum of colors and symbolize femininity and abundance.

name: Bachelor
description: Also known as cornflower, these charming, vibrant blue flowers symbolize delicacy and simplicity.

name: Bird of Paradise
description: With striking, bird-like blooms and bold tropical foliage, the Bird of Paradise plant adds a touch of exotic elegance to gardens and interiors worldwide, symbolizing freedom,

name: Begonia
description: Elegant and versatile, begonias feature vibrant, asymmetrical blooms and lush foliage.

name: Black-Eyed Susan
description: Cheerful and hardy, Black-Eyed Susans feature golden-yellow petals with a dark central disk, adding a burst of color to gardens.

name: Bleeding Heart
description: Graceful and enchanting, the Bleeding Heart plant boasts unique, heart-shaped flowers that dangle delicately from arching stems.

name: Calla Lily
description: Elegantly sculpted, the Calla Lily showcases sleek, trumpet-shaped blooms, symbolizing purity and beauty.

name: Chamomile
description: Delicate and aromatic, chamomile flowers, with their daisy-like appearance, are celebrated for their calming properties.

name: Chrysanthemum
description: With a rich cultural history, chrysanthemums boast diverse shapes and colors, symbolizing longevity, joy, and optimism.

name: Clematis
description: Graceful and climbing, clematis vines produce a profusion of intricate, star-shaped flowers in various colors.

name: Cosmos
description: Graceful and daisy-like, cosmos flowers present vibrant petals in shades of pink, white, and purple.

name: Iris
description: Graceful and vibrant, iris flowers showcase elegant, sword-shaped petals and come in a spectrum of hues,

name: Lilac
description: With its fragrant clusters of blossoms in shades of purple and white, the lilac symbolizes springtime beauty and holds a sweet,

name: Morning Glory
description: Radiant and ephemeral, morning glory flowers unfurl in the morning sun with colorful trumpet-shaped blooms, symbolizing beauty and the fleeting nature of time.

name: Foxglove
description: Elegantly tall and bell-shaped, foxglove flowers showcase speckled patterns and come in various hues, symbolizing both protection and charm.

name: Geranium
description: Known for its distinctive, lobed leaves and clusters of colorful blooms, geraniums are versatile and resilient plants,

name: Camellia
description: Elegant and glossy-leaved, camellia flowers showcase velvety petals in various hues, symbolizing love, admiration, and perfection.

name: Pansy
description: With distinctive faces and vibrant, heart-shaped petals, pansies symbolize love and free-thinking.

name: Violet
description: Delicate and dainty, violet flowers feature heart-shaped petals in shades of purple and blue, symbolizing modesty and faithfulness.

name: Sweet Pea
description: Fragrant and nostalgic, sweet peas symbolize blissful pleasure and are often associated with friendships.

name: Myosotis
description: Small and delicate, Myosotis symbolize true love and enduring connections.

name: Zinnia
description: Vibrant and resilient, zinnias bring a burst of color to gardens and symbolize endurance.

name: Gerbera Daisy
description: Cheerful and colorful, gerbera daisies convey joy and exuberance.

name: Jasmine
description: Jasmine flower, a plant rich in fragrant and beautiful flowers, is famous for its special sweetness and charm.

name: Hydrangea
description: With large, clustered blooms, hydrangeas symbolize heartfelt emotions and gratitude.

name: Orchid
description: Exotic and alluring, orchids represent beauty, strength, and love, captivating with their intricate blooms.

name: Magnolia
description: Majestic and fragrant, magnolias grace gardens with large, elegant blooms symbolizing beauty.

name: Narcissus
description: Delicate and trumpet-shaped, narcissus flowers, including daffodils.

name: Lotus
description: Sacred and serene, lotus flowers float above murky waters, representing purity, enlightenment, and spiritual rebirth.

name: Hyacinth
description: Fragrant and vibrant, hyacinths signify sincerity and play a delightful role in spring gardens with their colorful spikes of blossoms.

name: Gladiolus
description: Tall and stately, gladioli symbolize strength, integrity,

name: Gardenia
description: Exquisite and aromatic, gardenias symbolize purity and grace

name: Freesia
description: Delightfully fragrant and delicately shaped, freesias symbolize friendship and innocence, adding charm to floral arrangements.

name: Edelweiss
description: Alpine and enduring, edelweiss flowers symbolize courage and alpine purity, often associated with mountain landscapes.

name: Delphinium
description: Towering and vibrant, delphiniums symbolize goodwill and bring a sense of exuberance to gardens with their spiky clusters of colorful blooms.

name: Rhododendron
description: Rhododendrons have large, bell-shaped flowers that grow in clusters in a wide variety of colors, including purple, red, orange, white, pink, and yellow.

name: Queen Anne’s Lace
description: Queen Anne’s Lace is most identifiable by its white, lacy flowers.

name: Poinsettia
description: Poinsettias are the classic Christmas flower because of their bright red appearance.

name: Hellebore
description: Hellebore features exquisite bowl-shaped flowers in white, pinks, yellows, and reds.

name: Gladiolus
description: Gladiolus features a tall, striking stalk of blooms with a fragrant scent.

name: Forsythia
description: Forsythias are shrubs that can grow up to ten feet tall and twelve feet across.

name: Evening Primrose
description: Evening Primrose is a tall wildflower that blooms at sunset.

name: Coneflower
description: Coneflower has large flowers with spiny, dome-shaped, orange or brown centers that grow on sturdy stalks reaching up to five feet in height.

name: Dusty Miller
description: With its distinctive silver and lacy foliage, the Dusty Miller is a favorite of gardeners.

name: Ranunculus
description: Ranunculus come in all shades of warm colors, from yellow and red to purple and pink.

name: Petunia
description: In all shades from bright white to deep purple or red, Petunias bloom profusely from early summer until frost.

name: Crocus
description: green fruit used for its oil and brine-cured as olives.

name: Periwinkle
description: Periwinkle is often used by gardeners as an evergreen ground cover due to its dark green foliage.

name: Poppy
description: Bright red in color with big, showy flowers and feathery green foliage, poppies are a beautiful flower.

name: Snapdragon
description: Snapdragons can range from six inches to three feet depending on the variety.

name: Delphinium
description: Delphiniums are known for their large spikes of colorful flowers in bright shades of blue, pink, white, and purple.

name: Geranium
description: A classic garden plant, geranium flowers have five petals in white, pink, purple, or blue.

name: Buttercup
description: Buttercups feature single or loosely clustered flowers with yellow petals and green foliage.

name: Azalea
description: The leaves, size, and shape of azaleas vary greatly by variety, and they range in color from pink to red to salmon.

name: Peony
description: Peonies have large, wonderfully fragrant flowers, in colors including everything from purple and pink to darker shades of red.

name: Gardenia
description: Notable for their wax-like appearance and oval-shaped leaves

name: Calla Lily
description: Calla lilies come in a variety of different colors, from snow white to bright pink.

name: Alstroemeria
description: The alstroemeria, also called the Peruvian lily, features streaked or speckled blossoms in a range of colors, including white,

name: Snapdragons
description: Graceful and spiky, snapdragons add vertical interest to gardens and symbolize strength and grace.

name: Stargazer Lily
description: Striking and fragrant, the Stargazer Lily boasts vibrant, upward-facing blooms with deep pink or crimson hues and contrasting white edges,

name: Periwinkle
description: Periwinkle, also known as myrtle, is a popular ground cover with shiny dark green leaves that blooms in April and May with purple, blue, or white flowers.

name: Ornamental kale
description: Ornamental kale is a member of the cabbage family and is closely related to broccoli, cauliflower, cabbage, and Brussels sprouts.

name: Amaranthus
description: Amaranths comprise about 75 species that are native to every continent but Antarctica.

name: Gladiolus
description: Elegant gladiolus, or glads, from Europe and South Africa, make a bold statement in a garden, with trumpet-shaped flowers that open from bottom to top along tall stems.

name: Larkspur
description: Annual larkspur, native to Western Europe, the Mediterranean, and Asia, is a charming cottage garden plant that adds grace to a garden

name: Yarrow
description: Yarrow is a perennial in the aster family that is native to Europe, Asia, and North America.

name: Astilbe
description: Low-maintenance astilbe, with its 25 species native to Asia and North America and many cultivars from which to choose, is an easy flower for a beginner gardener to grow.

name: Cornflower
description: Cornflower blue is a color named for this perky annual garden flower

name: Crocus
description: For many of us, the first hint of spring is the little crocus pushing up through the snow.

name: Dianthus
description: Dianthus is a large genus that includes carnations and various types of pinks

name: Phlox
description: Phlox come in enough sizes and types to fill almost any niche in your garden.

name: California poppy
description: Also known as the golden poppy, this bright red, orange, or yellow native plant is the state flower of California.

name: Celosia
description: A native of the Mediterranean area and East Africa, celosia is a member of the amaranth family,

name: Agapanthus
description: Agapanthus, with their round clusters of blue, lavender, or white flowers sitting atop long, stiff stems, are showy and exotic additions to a garden as accent plants or in a grouping.

name: Lisianthus
description: This elegant flower, native to the prairies of North America, is an herbaceous perennial often grown as an annual in cool regions.

name: Campanula
description: Over 500 species of campanula, or bellflowers, are native to the Northern Hemisphere.

name: Liatris
description: Fuzzy liatris flowers in amethyst, pink, or white blaze up tall, slender stalks that rise out of clumps of grass-like leaves.

name: Gypsophila
description: Delicate sprays of baby’s breath, with their tiny white or pink flowers at the ends of threadlike branches

name: Scabiosa
description: Scabiosa, commonly known as pincushion flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the honeysuckle family Caprifoliaceae.

name: Stock
description: Stock, or gillyflower as it’s known in Britain, has graced cottage gardens for centuries and was a favorite flower of the Victorian era.

name: Hypericum
description: Commonly known as St. John’s Wort, this cheerful little plant is one of the easiest to grow in a home garden.

name: Eryngium
description: Blooming from June through September, eryngium, whose common name is sea holly, is a striking perennial that is a member of the carrot family. I

name: Brunia
description: Brunia, a woody, evergreen shrub, is native to the Cape Region of South Africa and is just beginning to be grown commercially in California, Australia, and New Zealand.

name: Salvia
description: Known for its vibrant spikes of tubular flowers, salvia comes in various colors and sizes, symbolizing wisdom and good health

name: Monkey orchid
description: The flowers of this orchid look remarkably like the face of a — you guessed it — monkey.

name: protea
description: This flower is very large — up to 12 inches in diameter.

name: Ghost orchid
description: A rare, endangered orchid that is leafless and grows on trees, with a shape like a floating ghost.

name: Skeleton flower
description: When they get wet, the petals of this simple white flower become transparent and appear to be made of ice.

name: Corpse
description: This huge, 100-pound plant only flowers once and gives off a strong, putrid odor.

name: Black bat flower
description: The wide petals of this flower resemble a bat with long, cascading whiskers.

name: African Boxwood
description: Not an actual boxwood, but rather a common name for Myrsine africana, an evergreen shrub native to South Africa.

name: Balsam
description: A fragrant annual plant, also known as Impatiens balsamina, featuring brightly colored, spurred flowers.

name: Flax
description: A versatile and cultivated plant, flax (Linum usitatissimum) is known for its slender stems and blue flowers.

name: Black Turmeric
description: Also known as Curcuma caesia, black turmeric is a rhizomatous perennial plant native to Northeast India.

name: Blue Water Lily
description: Also known as Nymphaea caerulea or blue lotus, the Blue Water Lily is a water plant with vibrant blue flowers.

name: Puncture Vine
description: Is a small plant with spiny fruits that split into sharp, hard seeds.

name: Shameplant
description: Mimosa pudica, commonly known as the shameplant or sensitive plant, is a unique and interactive plant known for its touch-sensitive leaves.

name: Delonix Regia
description: commonly known as the Flamboyant Tree or Royal Poinciana, is a tropical deciduous tree known for its stunning,

name: Hiptage
description: Hiptage benghalensis, commonly known as Hiptage, is a woody climbing shrub or vine with fragrant, white or yellowish flowers.

name: Angelica
description: Angelica is a short-lived perennial or hardy biennial herb in the carrot family.

name: Apache Plume
description: Apache Plume’s flowers are pinkish-white and attractive in combination with their dark foliage.

name: Buddleia
description: Commonly referred to as a butterfly bush, Buddleia davidii

name: Celosia
description: This plant is often used for decoration. Its leaves and flowers are also used as vegetables.

name: African Daisy
description: This is an excellent choice for anyone looking for bright, beautiful blooms all through summer into fall.

name: American Lotus
description: The American Lotus (Nelumbo lutea) is a native aquatic plant known for its large, fragrant, yellow flowers and distinctive circular leaves, thriving in ponds and slow-moving water bodies across North America.

name: Balloon Flower
description: This is a herbaceous perennial flower that produces plentiful bell-shaped deep blue or light pink flowers.

name: Bearberry
description: This is a slow-growing evergreen shrub that is extremely winter hardy.

name: Blue Passion Flower
description: Also known as the Common Passion Flower, this is an RHS award-winning bloom considered one of the most attractive climbers.

name: Checkered Lily
description: The Checkered Lily is a charming spring-blooming bulbous plant, distinguished by its bell-shaped flowers.

name: Chinese Pink
description: This is a stunningly showy flower that is a biennial or short-lived perennial.

name: Coral Bells
description: Coral Bells, or Heuchera, are perennial plants appreciated for their vibrant and diverse foliage, featuring a wide array of colors such as coral, red, purple, and green.

name: Wishbone Flower
description: This is a bushy annual that loves shady areas. It produces plenty of two-lipped trumpet-shaped flowers that are pale lavender in color rimmed with dark-purple edges.

name: West Indian Jasmine
description: West Indian Jasmine is a tropical plant usually found in tropical Asia

name: Vipers Bugloss
description: Viper's Bugloss  is a wildflower known for its striking spikes of bright blue to purple, funnel-shaped flowers and bristly, rough-textured foliage.

name: Crown Imperial
description: This showy bulbous herbaceous perennial produces a display of orange pendant, bell-shaped flowers.

name: Sugarbowl Clematis
description: This is a herbaceous perennial that produces urn-shaped, nodding blooms.

name: Stonecrop
description: Stonecrop, a common name for plants in the Sedum genus, refers to a diverse group of succulent perennials known for their fleshy, water-retaining leaves.

name: Starry Eyes
description: This evergreen perennial grows up to two feet tall and wide. It is a clump-forming plant with dark green foliage.

name: Spring Beauty
description: Claytonia virginica was named after him in 1739. The common name, spring beauty, is obvious. These flowers bloom first in spring

name: Snowdrop Windflower
description: The Snowdrop Windflower is a delicate late spring bloomer that grows up to 18 inches tall.

name: Silver Lupine
description: This is one of the showiest and fragrant Lupines. It is an evergreen perennial that produces beautiful palmate leaves that are silky and gray.

name: Showy Speedwell
description: This is another exotic spiky flower that is known for its ornamental display

name: Round-Headed Rampion
description: Also known as the Pride of Sussex, this is a herbaceous perennial plant that grows up to 20 inches tall.

name: Rosy Garlic
description: Also known as ornamental garlic, this elegant perennial is scented with a sweet but unmistakable onion aroma.

name: Red Torch Cactus
description: This is a columnar cactus that grows up to three feet in clumps.

name: Red Hot Poker
description: There are around 70 species in the Kniphofia genus, and this is one of the most stunning.

name: Quesnelia
description: This is a bromeliad from the genus Quesnelia native to Brazil.

name: Pincushion Flower
description: This is an annual or short-lived bushy perennial that produces intensely colored pincushion-like blooms.

name: Persian Buttercup
description: This wonderfully elegant flower is a favorite of florists and gardeners.

name: Peace Lily
description: The Peace Lily is a popular indoor houseplant known for its elegant, glossy green leaves and distinctive white, hood-like flowers.

name: Old Lady Cactus
description: The Mammillaria family has around 200 cacti species, most of which are native to Mexico.
